column5: I have a question any camps have handicapped access? Not for a totally disabled person but for someone who is functional but has a hard time walking. Age is a factor here. One of my clients her 84 yr old mother and her man have been doing a Canadian trip for years but have to stop because the lodge they go to cannot accommodate them. Please let me know. Thanks Eh!FC Look out I'm crossing the border in 7 days I cant wait..............
Holy Moly it's FC. Good to see ya. Here's your answer.http://www.bearpawlodge.net/
Smith Camps of Lake of the Woods Kenora has a handicap accessible cabin. They also have two cabins that are "right on the beach" easy access.
Bear paw lodge on caribou lake has a cabin and facilities set up for wheelchair
